definition: to mop the floor/(of a gown etc) to trail on the ground/full-length
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: I must sweep the floor and wash the dishes.
Three of us sweep and mop the floor and the remainder clean the window.
sentences.chinese: 我们之中三人扫地拖地板，其余的人擦玻璃。

sentences.english: She's been nagging at him to mop the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她一直罗罗唆唆地催他去拖地板。

sentences.english: Having cleaned the window, she began to wash the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她擦完窗户之后开始拖地板。

sentences.english: I must sweep the floor and wash dishes.
So, Maria started to wash the floor, while the nurse was looking on.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，Maria开始拖地板，而护士在一旁看着。

sentences.english: On Sundays, she often washes some clothes and mops the floor.
sentences.chinese: 星期天，她通常是洗洗衣服，拖拖地板。

sentences.english: I noticed a lone man in the cafeteria swabbing the floor as I passed.
sentences.chinese: 我路过时注意到一个男子独自在自助餐厅里拖地。

sentences.english: The bride's long dress began to drag along the ground.
sentences.chinese: 新娘的长连衣裙开始拖地前行。

sentences.english: Gordon mops the floor every Saturday .
The task includes sweeping the floor and cleaning the windows.
sentences.chinese: 任务包括拖地板和擦窗子。

sentences.english: She knew firsthand how hard it was to mop the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她知道用Firsthand来拖地板是特别累人。

sentences.english: Make sure trailing flexes are kept out of the way so you don't trip up over them.
sentences.chinese: 别让拖地的皮线挡了道，这样你就不会被绊倒。

sentences.english: Floor-length skirt with small train creates a dramatic silhouette.
sentences.chinese: 拖地的长裙配有精致的群裾衬托出引人注目的轮廓。

sentences.english: Amber is wearing a beautiful dress trailed on the ground on the award ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 采洁在颁奖礼上，身着一袭拖地长裙。

definition: to sweep the floor/to reach rock bottom/to be at an all-time low
to water the plants/to water the garden
